mdRecord.dcterms:title: Commodore William Edgar House, interior
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: McKim, Mead, and White (American architectural firm, 1879-1910) [work]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: The Edgar House is the last completed of a half dozen houses associated with the firm of McKim, Mead and White grouped within two blocks. By the time it was designed, the architects were beginning to abandon the shingled picturesqueness typical of their early houses in favor of the formality that characterizes the style for which the firm became famous. For much of their domestic architecture, this meant the American Colonial Revival. -- http://sah-archipedia.org/buildings/RI-01-NE90 [work]
